intro: Oreoselinum album, commonly known as white parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blossoms make it a desirable addition to gardens. Oreoselinum album is also valued for its culinary uses, though it is less commonly cultivated than its relatives.
